Authors:
Kalman Zoltan Vaczy, Mark Z. Nemeth, Anett Csikos, Gabor M.
Kovacs, Levente Kiss
Title:
Dothiorella omnivora isolated from grapevine with trunk
disease symptoms in Hungary
Keywords:
Botryosphaeriaceae, grapevine trunk diseases (GTDs),
Dothiorella spp.
Abstract:
During a four-year project conducted to identify fungal
species associated with grapevine trunk diseases (GTDs) in Hungarian
vineyards, two non-sporulating strains isolated from vines exhibiting
typical GTD symptoms were identified as Dothiorella omnivora based on
their rDNA ITS and EF1-α sequences. Conidial production of these strains
was induced on pine needle medium where spermatia have also been
observed. Pathogenicity tests confirmed their virulence on potted vines.
Dothiorella omnivora is a recently described species of the
Botryosphaeriaceae, known to infect hazelnut, ash, walnut, and other
woody hosts. This is its first European record from vines exhibiting GTD
symptoms. The EF1-α sequences determined in this work for D. omnivora
can be used as additional diagnostic markers for this species.
